title: Jazz Jackrabbit, anyone?
content:
I downloaded the demo of episode 1 but it wouldn't work on my 98 [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-sad.gif[/img] , does anyone have a demo version that works on 98s?[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-confused.gif[/img] -------------------

title: Re: Jazz Jackrabbit, anyone?
content:
I doubt there are other demos of it than the one you downloaded. I deeply doubt any Keener here would have anything special demo version..
Go bug some Jazz fans about this instead..You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Jazz Jackrabbit, anyone?
content:
Never use moslo, it sucky bigtime.

There are also two christmas demos; Holiday Hare 94 and Holiday Hare 95; they have christmassy stuff. I have a 1337 little trainer for it that allows you to freze the clock, have infinite lives and so on.A proud member of the Spleen Extinction society

title: Re: Jazz Jackrabbit, anyone?
content:
Some of you might be interested in the new version of the unofficial Jazz1 level editor. It came out yesterday. And it was made by Atomic Feline, Ice M A N, me and Unknown Rabbit and some other people. Unknown Rabbit also wanders around here from time to time.

Get it here
[url=http://www.jazz2online.com/jcs94/]www.jazz2online.com/jcs94/[/url]

title: Re: Jazz Jackrabbit, anyone?
content:
i downloaded the cd-rom version a while back, but since the site was illegal it got shutdown, the only way of getting it now is to buy it from epic classics for US$25

[url=http://www.epicclassics.com/orderform.html]www.epicclassics.com/orderform.html[/url]

or from ebay
[url=http://cgi.ebay.com.au/Jazz-Jackrabbit-Jazz-Trilogy-Rare-Classic-4Ship-PC_W0QQitemZ8233123944QQcategoryZ62053QQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem]cgi.ebay.com.au/Jazz-Jackrabbit-Jazz-Trilogy-Rare-Classic-4Ship-PC_W0QQitemZ8233123944QQcategoryZ62053QQrdZ1QQcmdZViewItem[/url]

ebay will most likely be cheaper but if you want the confindence that you won't be ripped off you will want to buy from epic classics
